title: Barbados to encourage more tourists from China to the islandTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Barbados to encourage more tourists from China to the island Published on : Saturday, October 17, 2015
Seeking to take advantage of current tourism trends Barbados plans to encourage more tourists from China to the island.
During a recent meeting at the Chinese embassy with several tourism officials, permanent secretary in the ministry of tourism and international transport, Donna Cadogan, gave this indication.
“China presents itself as a significant source market, as current trends point to its increasingly dynamic participation in world travel and tourism. Chinese travellers are travelling individually and are also showing a preference for more non-traditional destinations,” said Cadogan.
Last year, the Economist Magazine reported that nearly one in ten international tourists was Chinese, and that China is the largest spender in international tourism globally, she pointed out.
Barbados has taken steps to encourage more Chinese tourists t visit the island through the signing of a visa abolition agreement for holders of diplomatic and official passports with China in May 2014.
Cadogan added that both countries had exchanged model air services agreements and that work was proceeding on the conclusion of negotiations for the agreements.
Chief tourism development officer in the ministry, Nicole Alleyne, agreed that Barbados stood to benefit from marketing itself in China.
A Bilateral Tourism Seminar will be held from Oct 13 to Nov 2.
